content:
Task 32-43-00-810-833-A

Failure of the ABCU - (20170801)

Effective on: 001-999
Possible Causes

  • ABCU 95GG

  • PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L 101GG

  • PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW R 100GG

  • SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, L 97GG

  • SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, R 98GG

  • MANIFOLD-ALTN BRK, L 2853GM

  • MANIFOLD-ALTN BRK, R 2852GM

  • BSCU 10GG

    • 1. Possible Causes
    •

    ABCU (95GG)  

    •

    PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L (101GG)  

    •

    PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW R (100GG)  

    •

    SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, L (97GG)  

    •

    SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, R (98GG)  

    •

    MANIFOLD-ALTN BRK, L (2853GM)  

    •

    MANIFOLD-ALTN BRK, R (2852GM)  

    •

    REV

    BSCU  < REV (
    10GG)  <  

    2. Job Set-up Information
    A. Referenced Information

    REFERENCE

    DESIGNATION

    SEE AMM 29-24-00-863-001

    Pressurize the Yellow Hydraulic System with the Electric Pump

    SEE AMM 31-32-00-860-009

    Procedure to Get Access to the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G Page

    SEE

    AMM 32-42-34-000-001

    Removal of the Braking/Steering Control Unit (BSCU)

    SEE

    AMM 32-42-34-400-001

    Installation of the Braking/Steering Control Unit (BSCU)

    SEE AMM 32-43-00-710-002

    Operational Check to start the Functional Test of the Alternate Braking Automatically (flight simulated)
    Effective on: 001-999, 001-032, 783-799, 850-891, 894-899, 986-986

    SEE ASM 32-43-02

    		 
    Effective on: 001-100, 783-800, 850-891, 894-899, 986-986, 001-032, 783-799, 850-891, 894-899, 986-986

    SEE ASM 32-43-03

    		 

    SEE AMM 32-43-32-000-001

    Removal of the Alternate-Brake Manifold

    SEE AMM 32-43-32-400-001

    Installation of the Alternate-Brake Manifold

    SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001

    Removal of the Alternate Braking Control Unit (ABCU)

    SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001

    Installation of the Alternate Braking Control Unit (ABCU)

    SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001

    Removal of the Alternate-Brake Direct Drive Valve

    SEE AMM 32-43-35-400-001

    Installation of the Alternate-Brake Direct Drive Valve

    SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001

    Removal of the Pressure Transducer

    SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001

    Installation of the Pressure Transducer

    SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002

    BITE Test of the BSCU - Ground Scanning

    SEE AMM 32-69-00-860-001

    Simulation of Flight (With Aircraft on Ground)

    SEE AMM 34-10-00-860-005

    ADIRS Stop Procedure

    32-42-00-03

    NORMAL BRAKING - TASK SUPPORTING DATA
    3. Fault Confirmation

    Effective on: 001-100, 783-800, 850-891, 894-899, 986

    Effective When SB 32-1432, is PRE on: 001-032, 783-799, 850-891, 894-899, 986

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-740-080 -A0 - (20170801)

    A. Do a check for a message related to the alternate braking system on the Post Flight Report (PFR).
    (1) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 275:  < 
    (a) REV
    On panel 400VU, make sure that the landing-gear control lever is set to DOWN.  < 
    (b) Do a reset of the BSCU (10GG):
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    Set the A/SKID & N/W STRG switch to OFF, then to ON.  < 
    (c) REV
    On panel 110VU, make sure that PARKING BRK control switch 73GG is set to OFF.  < 
    (d) Pressurize the Yellow hydraulic system SEE AMM 29-24-00-863-001 .
    (e) REV
    Set PARKING BRK control switch 73GG to ON.  < 
    (f) Do the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002 .
    (g) REV
    Make sure that MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 275.  < 
    (h) REV
    If maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 275 is shown, go to para.4.A.  < 
    (2) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives the fault code 276:  < 
    (a) Go to para.4.B.
    (3) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives the fault code 277:  < 
    (a) REV
    On panel 400VU, make sure that the landing-gear control lever is set to DOWN.  < 
    (b) Do a reset of the BSCU (10GG):
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    Set the A/SKID & N/W STRG switch to OFF, then to ON.  < 
    (c) REV
    On panel 110VU, make sure that the PARKING BRK control switch is set to OFF.  < 
    (d) Do the ADIRS stop procedure SEE AMM 34-10-00-860-005 .
    (e) REV
    Do the simulation of flight, with the aircraft on the ground  <  < SEE AMM 32-69-00-860-001 .
    (f) Do the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002 .
    (g) REV
    Make sure that the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 277.  < 
    (h) REV
    If maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 277 is shown, go to para.4.A.  < 
    (4) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 1500, 1501, 1510, 1550, 1560, 1570 or 1580:  < 
    (a) REV
    Do the operational check to start the functional test of the alternate braking automatically (flight simulated)  <  < SEE AMM 32-43-00-710-002 .
    (b) Do the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002 .
    (c) REV
    Make sure that the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 1500, 1501, 1510, 1550, 1560, 1570 or 1580, and go to para.4.C.  < 
    (5) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 279:  < 
    (a) REV
    Open circuit breakers 1GG and 3GG. Then close circuit breaker 1GG first and then 3GG to make sure that you put BSCU CHAN 1 in the active mode.  < 
    1 REV
    Do the operational check to start the functional test of the alternate braking automatically (flight simulated)  <  < SEE REV
    AMM 32-43-00-710-002 <     REV
    .  < 
    2 REV
    Do the BITE test of the BSCU (Ground Scanning)  <  < SEE REV
    AMM 32-46-00-740-002 <     REV
    .  < 
    3 REV
    If the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to step (b).  < 
    4 REV
    If the MCDU does not show maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to step (c).  < 
    (b) REV
    Open circuit breaker 1GG. Then close it to make sure that you put BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    1 REV
    Do steps 3.A.(5).(a).1_ and 3.A.(5).(a).2_ again with BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    2 REV
    If the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to para.4.D.  < 
    3 REV
    If the MCDU does not show maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to para.4.E.  < 
    (c) REV
    Open circuit breaker 1GG. Then close it to make sure that you put BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    1 REV
    Do steps 3.A.(5).(a).1_ and 3.A.(5).(a).2_ again with BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    2 REV
    If the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to para.4.E.  < 

    Effective on: 892-893, 900-910, 928-950, 987-999

    Effective When SB 32-1432, is POST on: 001-032, 783-799, 850-891, 894-899, 986

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-740-080 -B0 - (20170801)

    A. Do a check for a message related to the alternate braking system on the Post Flight Report (PFR).
    (1) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 275:  < 
    (a) REV
    On panel 400VU, make sure that the landing-gear control lever is set to DOWN.  < 
    (b) Do a reset of the BSCU (10GG):
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    Set the A/SKID & N/W STRG switch to OFF, then to ON.  < 
    (c) REV
    On panel 110VU, make sure that PARKING BRK control switch 73GG is set to OFF.  < 
    (d) Pressurize the Yellow hydraulic system SEE AMM 29-24-00-863-001 .
    (e) REV
    Set PARKING BRK control switch 73GG to ON.  < 
    (f) Do the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002 .
    (g) REV
    Make sure that the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 275.  < 
    (h) REV
    If maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 275 is shown, go to para.4.A.  < 
    (2) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 276:  < 
    (a) Go to para.4.B.
    (3) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 277:  < 
    (a) REV
    On panel 400VU, make sure that the landing-gear control lever is set to DOWN.  < 
    (b) Do a reset of the BSCU (10GG):
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    Set the A/SKID & N/W STRG switch to OFF, then to ON.  < 
    (c) REV
    On panel 110VU, make sure that the PARKING BRK control switch is set to OFF.  < 
    (d) Do the ADIRS stop procedure SEE AMM 34-10-00-860-005 .
    (e) REV
    Do the simulation of flight, with the aircraft on the ground  <  < SEE AMM 32-69-00-860-001 .
    (f) Do the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002 .
    (g) REV
    Make sure that the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 277.  < 
    (h) REV
    If maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 277 is shown, go to para.4.A.  < 
    (4) If the PFR gives the maintenance message:
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    ABCU(95GG)/BRK ALTN PRESS TRANSDUCER(101GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 1500, or  < 
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    ABCU(95GG)/BRK ALTN PRESS TRANSDUCER(100GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 1501, or  < 
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 1510, 1550, 1560, 1570 or 1580:  < 
    (a) REV
    Do the operational check to start the functional test of the alternate braking automatically (flight simulated)  <  < SEE AMM 32-43-00-710-002 .
    (b) Do the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) SEE AMM 32-46-00-740-002 .
    (c) Make sure that the MCDU shows the maintenance message:
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    ABCU(95GG)/BRK ALTN PRESS TRANSDUCER(101GG) with fault code 1500, or  < 
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    ABCU(95GG)/BRK ALTN PRESS TRANSDUCER(100GG) with fault code 1501, or  < 
    •
    		REV < 

    REV

    ABCU (95GG) with fault code 1510, 1550, 1560, 1570 or 1580:  < 
    (d) Go to para.4.C.
    (5) REV
    If the PFR gives maintenance message ABCU (95GG) and the TROUBLE SHOOTING DATA gives fault code 279:  < 
    (a) REV
    Open circuit breakers 1GG and 3GG. Then close circuit breaker 1GG first, then 3GG to make sure that you put BSCU CHAN 1 in the active mode.  < 
    1 REV
    Do the operational check to start the functional test of the alternate braking automatically (flight simulated)  <  < SEE REV
    AMM 32-43-00-710-002 <     REV
    .  < 
    2 REV
    Do the BITE test of the BSCU (Ground Scanning)  <  < SEE REV
    AMM 32-46-00-740-002 <     REV
    .  < 
    3 REV
    If the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to step (b).  < 
    4 REV
    If the MCDU does not show maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to step (c).  < 
    (b) REV
    Open circuit breaker 1GG. Then close it to make sure that you put BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    1 REV
    Do steps 3.A.(5).(a).1_ and 3.A.(5).(a).2_ again with BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    2 REV
    If the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to para.4.D.  < 
    3 REV
    If the MCDU does not show maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to para.4.E.  < 
    (c) REV
    Open circuit breaker 1GG. Then close it to make sure that you put BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    1 REV
    Do steps 3.A.(5).(a).1_ and 3.A.(5).(a).2_ again with BSCU CHAN 2 in the active mode.  < 
    2 REV
    If the MCDU shows maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with fault code 279, go to para.4.E.  < 

    4. Fault Isolation

    Effective on: 001-999

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-810-082 -A0 - (20130201)

    A. If the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) gives the maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with the fault code 275 or 277:
    (1) Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .
    (2) If the fault continues:
    •

    do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10C to pin A/Y.


    Effective on: 001-999

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-810-088 -A0 - (20170501)

    B. If the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) gives the maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with the fault code 276:
    (1) Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .
    (2) If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10C to pin A/y SEE ASM 32-43-02 .


    Effective on: 001-100, 783-800, 850-891, 894-899, 986

    Effective When SB 32-1432, is PRE on: 001-032, 783-799, 850-891, 894-899, 986

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-810-089 -A0 - (20170501)

    C. If the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) gives the maintenance message ABCU (95GG) with the fault code 1500, 1501, 1510, 1550, 1560, 1570 or 1580:
    (1) Pressurize the Yellow hydraulic system SEE AMM 29-24-00-863-001 .
    (2) Set the PARKING BRK control switch 73GG to ON.
    (3) On the MCDU, get the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G page SEE AMM 31-32-00-860-009 .
    (4) On the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G page, push the line key adjacent to the BSCU CHAN 1(2) indication.
    (5) On the BSCU CHAN 1(2) page, push the line key adjacent to the SPECIFIC DATA indication
    Effective on: 001-100, 783-800, 850-891, 894-899, 986-986 32-42-00-03 .
    (6) On the BSCU CHAN 1(2)/SPECIFIC DATA page, push the line key adjacent to the SYSTEM DATA page.
    (7) Push the line key adjacent to the REFRESH indication.
    (8) Do a check of the Alternate Pressure Transducer Left (APTL) and the Alternate Pressure Transducer Right (APTR) pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3.
    (9) Print the SYSTEM DATA of the BSCU CHAN 1(2) page 1/3.
    NOTE:   
    The supply pressure value of the Yellow hydraulic system must be 206 +7 -7 bar (3000 +100 -100 psi).
    (a) For the fault code 1500:
    1 Do a check of the APTL pressure value given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTL pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L (101GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    b If the APTL pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .

    2 If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/6H to pin A/q,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/7H to pin A/r,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/8H to pin A/s,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/9H to pin A/t,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10H to pin A/u,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the LGCIU1(5GA1) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/2J to pin A/FF,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/9C to pin A/x SEE ASM 32-43-02 , SEE ASM 32-43-03 .

    (b) For the fault code 1501:
    1 Do a check of the APTR pressure value given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTR pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW R (100GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    b If the APTR pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .

    2 If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/6H to pin A/q,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/7H to pin A/r,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/8H to pin A/s,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/9H to pin A/t,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10H to pin A/u,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the LGCIU1(5GA1) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/2J to pin A/FF.

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/8C to pin A/w SEE ASM 32-43-02 , SEE ASM 32-43-03 .

    (c) For the fault code 1510:
    1 Do a check of the APTL and the APTR pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTL and the APTR pressure values are less than 30 bar (435.11 psi):
    •

    Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .

    2 If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/6H to pin A/q,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/7H to pin A/r,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/8H to pin A/s,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/9H to pin A/t,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10H to pin A/u,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the LGCIU1(5GA1) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/2J to pin A/FF,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the LGCIU2(5GA2) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/4F to pin A/e SEE ASM 32-43-02 , SEE ASM 32-43-03 .

    (d) For the fault code 1550:
    1 Do a check of the APTL and the APTR pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTL pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L (101GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    b If the APTR pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW R (100GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    c If the APTL pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Read the trouble shooting data of the fault code 1550, do a check of the APTL pressure value and if it is more than 13 bar (188.55 psi):

    . Replace the SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, L (97GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 .

    d If the APTR pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Read the trouble shooting data of the fault code 1550, do a check of the APTR pressure value and if it is more than 13 bar (188.55 psi):

    . Replace the SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, R (98GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 .

    2 If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/1A to pin A/K,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/1B to pin A/L,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/3A to pin A/M,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/3B to pin A/N,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/1F to pin B/K SEE ASM 32-43-02 , SEE ASM 32-43-03 .

    (e) For the fault code 1560:
    1 Do a check of the APTL and the APTR pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTL pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L (101GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    b If the APTR pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW R (100GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    c If the APTL pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Read the trouble shooting data of the fault code 1560, do a check of the APTL pressure value and if it is more than 85 bar (1232.82 psi):

    . Replace the SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, L (97GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-35-400-001 .

    d If the APTR pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Read the trouble shooting data of the fault code 1560, do a check of the APTR pressure value and if it is more than 85 bar (1232.82 psi):

    . Replace the SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, R (98GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-35-400-001 .

    (f) For the fault code 1570:
    1 Do a check of the APTL and the APTR pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTL pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L (101GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    b If the APTR pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW R (100GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    c If the APTL pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Read the trouble shooting data of the fault code 1570, do a check of the APTL pressure value and if it is less than 10 bar (145.04 psi) or more than 30 bar (435.11 psi):

    . Replace the SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, L (97GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-35-400-001 .

    •

    If the fault continues:

    . Replace the MANIFOLD-ALTN BRK, L (2853GM)   SEE AMM 32-43-32-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-32-400-001 .

    d If the APTR pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Read the trouble shooting data of the fault code 1570, do a check of the APTR pressure value and if it is less than 10 bar (145.04 psi) or more than 30 bar (435.11 psi):

    . Replace the SERVOVALVE-ALTN BRK, R (98GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-35-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-35-400-001 .

    •

    If the fault continues:

    . Replace the MANIFOLD-ALTN BRK, R (2852GM)   SEE AMM 32-43-32-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-32-400-001 .

    2 If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/6H to pin A/q,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/7H to pin A/r,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/8H to pin A/s,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/9H to pin A/t,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10H to pin A/u,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the LGCIU1(5GA1) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AB/2J to pin A/FF,

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the PBSV(102GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin B/5 to pin A/DD SEE ASM 32-43-02 , SEE ASM 32-43-03 .

    (g) For the fault code 1580:
    1 Do a check of the APTL and the APTR pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    a If the APTL and the APTR pressure values are more than 13 bar (188.55 psi):
    •

    Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .

    2 If the fault continues:
    a Pressurize the Yellow hydraulic system SEE AMM 29-24-00-863-001 .
    b Set the PARKING BRK control switch 73GG to ON.
    c On the MCDU, get the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G page SEE AMM 31-32-00-860-009 .
    d On the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G page, push the line key adjacent to the BSCU CHAN 1(2) indication.
    e On the BSCU CHAN 1(2) page, push the line key adjacent to the SPECIFIC DATA indication
    Effective on: 001-100, 783-800, 850-891, 894-899, 986-986 32-42-00-03 .
    f On the BSCU CHAN 1(2)/SPECIFIC DATA page, push the line key adjacent to the SYSTEM DATA page.
    g Push the line key adjacent to the REFRESH indication.
    h Do a check of the APTL and the APTR pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).
    i Print the SYSTEM DATA of the BSCU CHAN 1(2) page 1/3.
    j If the APTL pressure value is not equal to 145 +10 -10 bar (2103.05 +145.04 -145.04 psi):
    •

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-810-089 -B0 - (20170501)

    C. If the BITE test of the BSCU (GROUND SCANNING) gives the maintenance message:
    •

    ABCU(95GG)/BRK ALTN PRESS TRANSDUCER(101GG) with the fault code 1500 or

    •

    ABCU(95GG)/BRK ALTN PRESS TRANSDUCER(100GG) with the fault code 1501 or

    •

    ABCU (95GG) with the fault code 1510, 1550, 1560, 1570 or 1580:

    (1) Pressurize the Yellow hydraulic system SEE AMM 29-24-00-863-001 .
    (2) Set the PARKING BRK control switch 73GG to ON.
    (3) On the MCDU, get the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G page SEE AMM 31-32-00-860-009 .
    (4) On the SYSTEM REPORT/TEST/L/G page, push the line key adjacent to the BSCU CHAN 1(2) indication.
    (5) On the BSCU CHAN 1(2) page, push the line key adjacent to the SPECIFIC DATA indication
    32-42-00-03 .
    (6) On the BSCU CHAN 1(2)/SPECIFIC DATA page, push the line key adjacent to the SYSTEM DATA page.
    (7) Push the line key adjacent to the REFRESH indication.
    (8) Do a check of the Alternate Pressure Transducer Left (APTL) and the Alternate Pressure Transducer Right (APTR) pressure values given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3.
    (9) Print the SYSTEM DATA of the BSCU CHAN 1(2) page 1/3.
    NOTE:   
    The supply pressure value of the Yellow hydraulic system must be 206 +7 -7 bar (3000 +100 -100 psi).
    (a) For the fault code 1500:
    1 Do a check of the APTL pressure value given in the SYSTEM DATA page 1/3 printed in step (9).

    •

    Replace the PRESS XDCR-BRK, YELLOW L (101GG)   SEE AMM 32-44-19-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-44-19-400-001 .

    b If the APTL pressure value is in the limits:
    •

    Replace the ABCU (95GG)   SEE AMM 32-43-34-000-001 , SEE AMM 32-43-34-400-001 .

    •

    SUBTASK 32-43-00-810-095 -A0 - (20170801)

    D.
    If the BITE test of the BSCU (Ground Scanning) gives fault code 279 with BSCU system 1 active and with BSCU system 2 active:
    (1)
    Replace the ABCU (95GG) SEE
    AMM 32-43-34-000-001
    and SEE
    AMM 32-43-34-400-001
    .
    (2)
    If the fault continues:
    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10C to pin A/Y

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/6H to pin A/q

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/7H to pin A/r

    •

    •

    Do a check and repair the wiring from the BSCU(10GG) to the ABCU(95GG) pin AC/10H to pin A/u SEE
    ASM 32-43-02
    .
